availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles E. Johnson (Fleming County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier)

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Kentucky native. Attorney in Fleming County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 16th Kentucky Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from January 27, 1862, to July 1863. Served in the 2nd Division of the 23rd Regiment (U.S.A.) as provost marshal from July 1863, to January 1, 1864. Served in the 16th Kentucky Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as sergeant major and captain from January 1, 1864, to August 4, 1865. Served in 1st Brigade Headquarters (U.S.A.) as clerk from December 20, 1864, to July 15, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 2, p. 614.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 293.
